lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Aihinis mid rhq BwNjn ibKY jwnq n mrmu ikDau kvn pRkwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ahinisi Madi Rahat Bhaanjan Bikhai , Jaanat N Maramu Kidhau Kavan Prakaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as wine remains in a bottle day and night but that bottle/ pot does not know its characteristics.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bylI Bir Bir bwNit dIjIAq sBw pwvq n Bydu kCu ibiD n bIcwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Baylee Bhari Bhari Baanti Deejeeat Sabhaa , Paavat N Bhaydu Kachhu Bidhi N Beechaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as in a party, wine is distributed in cups, but that cup does not know its (wine) secret nor thinks about it.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy idnpRiq mdu bycq klwl bYTy mihmw n jwneI drb ihqkwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dinaprati Madu Baychat Kalaal Baitthay , Mahimaa N Jaanaee Darab Hitakaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wine merchant sells wine all the time during the day but his greed of wealth does not know the significance of its intoxication.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur sbd ky iliK piV gwvq hY ibrlo AMmiRq rsu pdu AiDkwrI hY ]530]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Sabad Kay Likhi Parhi Gaavat Hai , Biralo Anmrit Rasu Padu Adhikaaree Hai ?530?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly many write Gur Shabad and Gurbani, sing and read it but. a rare person among them harbours loving desire of relishing and acquiring the divine elixir from it.  (530)
